list_definition.definition: a woman about to be married, or newly married

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bride wore a white dress.

list_ex_of_english: But when he was eventually married, his bride turned out to have a lover.
In popular perception the younger the bride the more malleable she is considered to be to the wishes of her conjugal family.
One of the items most frequently included in the trousseaux brought by rich brides to their husbands was silk cloth.
Where village exogamous marriages occur, they generally take place in the village of the bride.
Here, however, the self-sacrice was to be on the part of the bride, the vocation on the part of the prospective husband.
This even holds true for a bride's father.
However, in the second half of that century, the age of first-time brides fell considerably.
What has, however, seen drastic changes are the brides and the marriage gifts.
